description: The man who led Canada’s trade negotiating team during Donald Trump’s first term said the US President-elect “likes tariffs even more now” and will be less constrained about about using them in his second.
title: Trump Loves Tariffs But Canada Can Strike Back on Oil, Ex-Trade Chief Says

description: Keir Starmer will set out targets for fighting crime in Britain, in a major speech Thursday aimed at resetting his premiership after a faltering start in the first five months since Labour won the general election.
title: Starmer Vows to Tackle UK Street Crime in Bid to Rebuild Support

description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro promoted deputy finance minister Diego Guevara to fix the most serious fiscal situation his government has yet faced.
title: Petro Promotes Guevara to Be Colombia’s New Finance Minister

description: The second Trump administration should shift investments at the Pentagon in favor of emerging technologies such as drones and hypersonic missiles, according to Vivek Ramaswamy, the former presidential candidate who has been tapped along with Elon Musk to cut wasteful spending.
title: Vivek Ramaswamy Wants to Shift Defense Spending to New Technology

description: Chinese hackers compromised eight American telecommunications companies as part of a wide-ranging espionage effort to gather intelligence about prominent US citizens, Biden administration officials said Wednesday.
title: Chinese Hackers Breached Eight US Telecom Providers, White House Says

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk previews the anticipated battle over cutting government spending. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Brewing Battle Over Government Spending Cuts

description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin rebuked his potential successor for his opposition to women serving in combat roles, saying it would be wrong and counterproductive to undo decades of progress.
title: Defense Chief Rebukes Hegseth’s Stance on Women in Combat Roles

description: The US chairman of the joint chiefs of staff spoke with his Russian counterpart for the first time in more than a year, discussing Ukraine and other matters as tensions continue to rise between the two adversaries.
title: US, Russian Military Chiefs Speak for First Time in Over a Year

description: The country has never been closer to a Le Pen administration — the one thing President Macron has sought to avoid at all costs.
title: Macron’s Grand Project in Ruins After French Government Falls

description: Here are the key takeaways after France’s government fell in a no-confidence vote over its budget plan. For more, click here for our TOPLive blog.
title: Key Takeaways From France’s No-Confidence Vote

description: Far-right leader Marine Le Pen teamed up with a left-wing coalition to topple the French government, pitching the country into a prolonged period of turbulence that’s likely to further unsettle investors.
title: French Far Right Joins Forces With Left to Topple Government

description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said he’s confident he’ll have a similar relationship with the incoming administration, including Treasury nominee Scott Bessent, as he has now.
title: Powell Says He Expects Good Relations With Trump Administration

description: The International Monetary Fund’s internal watchdog has criticized the lender’s process for granting unusually large loans to troubled borrowers such as Argentina and Egypt, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: IMF’s Internal Watchdog Critiques Its Handling of Largest Loans

description: Allies of President-elect Donald Trump criticized a deal to extend hybrid work options for some federal staff until 2029, saying the agreement between the Social Security Administration and its union undermines return-to-office efforts.
title: Trump Allies Blast Work-From-Home Extension for Federal Staff

description: Colombian finance chief Ricardo Bonilla is expected to quit at a critical stage in the government’s attempts to push tax hikes through congress.
title: Colombia President Says His Finance Chief Expected to Quit

description: President-elect Donald Trump said he would appoint David Warrington as White House counsel, substituting his campaign lawyer for a previously announced pick to serve as the president’s chief in-house lawyer.
title: Trump Swaps White House Counsel Pick, Tapping David Warrington

description: Pete Hegseth, President-elect Donald Trump’s embattled choice for defense secretary, is likely to face the toughest grilling he’s had on Capitol Hill so far when he meets Wednesday afternoon with a fellow military veteran, Republican Senator Joni Ernst.
title: Pete Hegseth’s Narrowing Chances for Defense Post Now Turn on Ernst

description: The Canadian province of Alberta, home to the world’s third-largest crude reserves, is making a push to become a hub for artificial intelligence data centers and sees the potential to attract C$100 billion ($71 billion) in investments.
title: Home of Canada’s Oil Sands Chases $71 Billion Data Center Opportunity

description: The European Union needs to ramp up efforts to unify its fragmented financial infrastructure, European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said in an op-ed for the Economist.
title: Europe Must Refocus Capital-Markets-Union Efforts, Lagarde Says

description: Paul Atkins, a veteran financial regulator and a fixture in Washington’s conservative financial circles, is President-elect Donald Trump’s choice to lead and possibly overhaul the US Securities and Exchange Commission.
title: Trump Picks Atkins, Ex-SEC Commissioner, to Succeed Gensler

description: Romania’s pro-European parties signed a deal to form a coalition in an attempt to keep nationalist forces out of power ahead of a presidential election run-off on Sunday that has a Russia-friendly candidate as the front-runner.
title: Romania Pro-EU Parties Agree Coalition to Fend Off Far-Right

description: President-elect Donald Trump has selected Gail Slater, an Oxford-educated economic policy adviser to Vice President-elect JD Vance, to head up antitrust enforcement at the Justice Department.
title: Trump Taps Vance Aide Gail Slater as Top DOJ Antitrust Cop

description: Kenyan lawmakers approved the reinstatement of some tax measures that the government agreed to abandon earlier this year after thousands of people took to the streets in protest.
title: Kenyan Lawmakers Agree to Reinstate Taxes That Ignited Protests

description: President-elect Donald Trump selected finance professor Michael Faulkender — who implemented a key pandemic-era relief program during his first presidency — to be the deputy Treasury secretary.
title: Trump Picks Faulkender as Bessent’s Deputy Treasury Secretary

description: Incoming Senate Republican leader John Thune said he expects to discuss Treasury secretary nominee Scott Bessent’s views on tariffs and the Federal Reserve ahead of nomination hearings.
title: Trump’s Treasury Pick to Meet With GOP Senators With Fed and Tariffs on Agenda

description: Chile’s Congress gave its final approval to a bill that creates a Public Security Ministry, handing President Gabriel Boric a win as his government steps up efforts to combat crime.
title: Chile Congress Creates Public Security Ministry in Win for Boric

description: Scotland’s government plans to remove a limit on child benefits, a high-profile move by the ruling Scottish National Party to challenge a controversial policy that the Labour Party kept after its huge UK election victory this year.
title: Scotland to Remove Child-Benefit Cap in Challenge to Labour Party

description: President-elect Donald Trump tapped Peter Navarro as his senior counselor for trade and manufacturing, elevating the formerly incarcerated adviser back to a role similar to the one he played in the previous Trump administration.
title: Trump Taps Peter Navarro as Trade, Manufacturing Counselor

description: Mozambique’s president cautioned that ongoing protests against disputed Oct. 9 elections are increasing the risk of delays to civil servants’ pay, as the unrest hits tax revenues.
title: Mozambique President Warns Protests Risk Pay Delays for Workers

description: Mexico President Claudia Sheinbaum’s efforts to increase security on the nation’s highways is getting results as preliminary estimates show that cargo theft has declined in the early weeks of her administration
title: Sheinbaum’s Team Claims Gains Under Mexico Highway Security Plan

description: President-elect Donald Trump said he will nominate financial technology billionaire and veteran SpaceX astronaut Jared Isaacman to serve as the next NASA administrator.
title: Trump Picks Billionaire Who Did Private Space Walk to Lead NASA

description: President-elect Donald Trump says he has picked Peter Navarro to serve as Senior Counselor for Trade and Manufacturing, according to a Truth Social post.
title: Trump Picks Navarro for Senior Counselor for Trade

description: Ireland is disproportionately exposed to increased geopolitical risks, the Central Bank governor said Wednesday, pointing to the outsized number of multinational companies that are central to the domestic economy.
title: Increased Geopolitical Risks Negative for Ireland, Makhlouf Says

description: Media personality Tucker Carlson, an influential ally of President-elect Donald Trump, said he’d interviewed Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov in Moscow, amid speculation over the incoming US administration’s plans to rapidly end the war in Ukraine.
title: Tucker Carlson Interviews Russian Foreign Minister on War in Ukraine

description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said she favors joint European Union financing for common goods such as security and climate transition.
title: ECB’s Lagarde Says Common EU Financing Is ‘Desirable’

description: Former head of state Michelle Bachelet ranked as Chile’s most popular politician in a new poll, fueling debate on whether she could attempt a comeback for the center-left in next year’s presidential election.
title: Bachelet Towers Over Chile Politics as Presidential Debate Grows

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s approval is declining even as Brazil’s economy remains strong, highlighting the risks rising prices and his own spending policies pose as he enters the second half of his term.
title: Lula Approval Drops With Rising Prices Outweighing Strong Economy

description: Mexicans are turning dour on the economy just two months into the nation’s new administration, a poll showed, highlighting a problem that could become much worse if US President-elect Donald Trump enacts trade tariffs.
title: Mexicans’ Economic Outlook Sours as Trump’s Tariff Threats Loom

description: President Javier Milei’s approval rating recovered last month as the economy showed signs of recovery and inflation cooled to its lowest point in nearly three years.
title: Milei Gains Popularity as Argentina’s Economy Shows Sign of Life

description: Donald Trump’s return to the White House has divided Latin America, with residents in its largest economies expressing the most concern about the incoming US administration.
title: Trump Splits Latin America, Worrying Mexicans and Brazilians Most

description: Michel Barnier looks on during the debate prior to the no-confidence votes on his administration at the National Assembly in Paris, on Dec. 4. Photographer: Amaury Cornu/AFP/Getty Images
title: French Premier Defends Record Before No-Confidence Vote

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s team is considering replacing embattled Defense Secretary nominee Pete Hegseth with Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, a swap that would elevate a one-time rival to a prime cabinet position.
title: Trump Considers Replacing Hegseth With DeSantis as Pentagon Pick

description: Egypt will offer three or four military-affiliated companies on the stock exchange as a next step in the wide-ranging drive to sell state assets, Prime Minister Mostafa Madbouly said.
title: Egypt to Offer Up to Four Military-Linked Firms on Stock Market

description: A week before Donald Trump fired off yet another tariff threat on his neighbors, Justin Trudeau and Claudia Sheinbaum had a chance to confer in person about how to tackle that very scenario. Would they join forces against their errant trading partner or was it going to be a case of every person for themselves?
title: When Trump Threatens, Canada and Mexico Go Their Own Way

description: President Joe Biden is rounding off his trip to Angola by announcing $600 million in new financing for a multi-country railway as the US looks to bolster its investment in critical minerals infrastructure in Africa and curb Chinese influence.
title: Biden Unveils $600 Million in New Financing for African Railway

description: Ukraine’s allies have shifted their focus from seeking a victory to trying to put President Volodymyr Zelenskiy in the best position to counter Russian advances or negotiate a possible ceasefire, people familiar with the matter said.
title: NATO Seeks to Position Kyiv for Truce Talks With Arms Plan Shift

description: Chris Wright has championed fossil fuels as a moral good and characterized climate change as modest
title: Energy CEO Who Drank Fracking Fluid Is Now Trump’s Oil Evangelist

description: Cuba is without power again after a failure at a key plant near the capital brought down the national electrical grid.
title: Cuba’s Power Grid Collapses Again, Leaving Entire Island in Dark

description: Lisbon’s municipal assembly approved a proposal to hold a referendum about ending short-term rentals in residential buildings as the Portuguese capital struggles with a lack of affordable housing.
title: Lisbon Assembly Backs Proposed Referendum on Short-Term Rentals

description: France looked set for more political turmoil after both the far-right National Rally and the leftist Socialists said they would vote to bring down the government.
title: French Government Set to Be Toppled in No-Confidence Vote

description: German conservative lawmaker Jens Spahn said the government should seek a common strategy with US president-elect Donald Trump to boost transatlantic trade while reducing its economic dependency on China.
title: Germany Needs Trade Deal With Trump, Conservative Lawmaker Says

description: Singapore’s ruling party appointed Prime Minister Lawrence Wong as its secretary general, in a widely expected move ahead of a general election due next year.
title: Singapore PM Wong Appointed Chief of Ruling Party Ahead of Poll

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: South Korea Shaken by Martial Law Disaster

description: The potential impeachment of South Korea’s president after an aborted attempt to impose martial law may complicate US efforts to increase pressure on China under President-elect Donald Trump by undermining American-led alliances in East Asia.
title: South Korean Turmoil Strikes at Heart of US Alliances in Asia

description: Looking at their hairstyles, social media and tactics against opponents, Donald Trump and Argentine President Javier Milei seem to be cut from the same cloth. But style and substance are two different things.
title: Why Donald Trump and Javier Milei Are Worlds Apart on Austerity

description: President-elect Donald Trump says he has plenty of ways to shrink the federal government: get rid of the Department of Education; empower two wealthy allies to start an unofficial Department of Government Efficiency; and slash the bureaucracy that regulates government. And one other idea: don’t spend all the money Congress tells him to spend.
title: Trump Vows to ‘Impound’ Money Congress Appropriates. Can He Do It?

description: British and German firms in China are having a tougher time doing business and worry about the outlook for next year, according to two new surveys.
title: European Business Groups’ Surveys Find Rising China Challenges

description: Just before 10 p.m. on a near-freezing evening in Seoul, rumors began circulating among reporters that South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol planned a late-night announcement.
title: How Six Hours of Martial Law Reshaped a Stunned South Korea

description: Bank of Korea Governor Rhee Chang-yong said it is unlikely the central bank will cut interest rates in response to a short-lived political event.
title: BOK Chief Rhee Says Unlikely to Cut Rates on Political Turmoil

description: Container lines and operators of US East and Gulf Coast port terminals said they won’t continue bargaining with union dockworkers on a new six-year contract if it means giving up their right to invest in semi-automated cargo handling equipment.
title: US Port Employers Call Automation ‘Core’ Priority in Labor Talks

description: The latest protests in Tbilisi are a reminder of the Maidan movement in 2013, but the government is in no mood for compromise.
title: After Revolution and War, Is Georgia Echoing Ukraine’s Uprising?

description: The UK’s Labour government will nationalize three train services currently run by the private sector, the start of a plan to take the industry back into public hands.
title: UK’s Labour Kicks Off Nationalization With Three Train Lines

description: A former South Korean Trade Minister criticized President Yoon Suk Yeol for his ill-fated decision to decree martial law that sparked a public outcry and jolted financial markets around the world.
title: Yoon Made Grave Mistake, Says Former South Korea Trade Minister

description: A second impeachment complaint was filed against Philippines Vice President Sara Duterte at the House of Representatives on Wednesday, in the latest bid to oust her after her apparent threat to have President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. killed.
title: Philippines VP Duterte Faces Second Impeachment Complaint

description: Captain Avhilash Rawat had just finished dinner when an anti-ship ballistic missile smashed into his oil tanker.
title: What It’s Like to Captain a Tanker on Fire After a Houthi Attack

description: Democrat Adam Gray, a former state assemblyman, defeated Republican incumbent John Duarte in California’s 13th Congressional District, according to AP.
title: Democrats Flip Key California House Seat as Duarte Defeated

description: The Malaysian government has come under fire for its plan to tighten its grip over the internet, via regulations that critics warn could suppress dissent and undermine Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim’s pledge to protect free speech.
title: Malaysia Faces Backlash Over Plan to Broaden Internet Controls

description: Iran will weigh sending troops to Syria if President Bashar Al-Assad requested such a move to stop a rebel advance that’s causing the biggest threat to his rule in years.
title: Iran Would Consider Any Call From Assad to Send Troops to Syria

description: China isn’t short of options when it comes to critical minerals that could be used as counters in a trade war with the US.
title: China’s Trade Reprisals May Extend to Minerals Like Rare Earths

description: Malaysia and Singapore will postpone next week’s signing to formalize a special economic zone in Johor, Malaysia Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said on Wednesday.
title: Malaysia, Singapore Postpone Economic Zone Deal to January

description: Donald Trump will head to his home state of New York on Thursday to be honored at an annual awards show hosted by Fox News, the conservative network long favored by Republican politicians and their supporters.
title: Trump Will Receive Award at Fox News Ceremony on Long Island

description: Thailand’s inflation remained below the central bank’s target range for a sixth straight month, raising the pressure for the monetary authority to reduce borrowing costs.
title: Thai Inflation Stays Below BOT Target Range for Sixth Month

description: Yuichiro Tamaki, a kingmaker for Japan’s minority government, will temporarily step down as his party’s leader amid a scandal over an alleged marital infidelity.
title: Japan DPP’s Tamaki Temporarily Steps Down as Head Over Scandal

description: The indebted West African state — which goes to the polls on Dec. 7 — is potentially losing billions from illegal gold mining that is causing environmental carnage. Will the government close it down?
title: The Fight Over Ghana’s Illegal Gold Rush Exposes Election Risks

description: A dramatic move by South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol to impose martial law and his reversal hours later has immediately raised questions about the future of the deeply unpopular leader. Yoon has already faced calls from opposition politicians to stand down and he could be impeached by parliament if he doesn’t do so. The president’s term runs through 2027 but if he leaves office sooner, it would trigger an election to decide his successor.
title: Leading Contenders Who Might Replace South Korean President Yoon

description: For the first time since South Korea achieved full democracy nearly 40 years ago, a president invoked martial law, igniting a political crisis with global political implications and initially causing a sharp decline in the nation’s asset prices. The decree was rescinded about six hours later amid a fierce public backlash and a rare unanimous vote in parliament calling for it to end.
title: What’s Behind South Korea’s Martial Law Chaos and Why It Matters

description: South Korea’s main opposition party announced that it would seek to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol after he shocked the nation by briefly imposing martial law.
title: South Korea Opposition Party Seeks to Impeach Yoon for Treason

description: Angry South Koreans rallied against President Yoon Suk Yeol after his foiled attempt to put the country under martial law roiled a nation that’s deeply scarred by a long history of authoritarian crackdowns.
title: As Koreans Emerge From Martial Law Chaos, Shock Turns to Anger

description: The Philippines said a China Coast Guard ship fired a water cannon at its vessel, while a Chinese Navy ship did “dangerous” moves around a disputed South China Sea shoal.
title: Philippines Says China Ship Fired Water Cannon on Its Vessel

description: South Korea’s currency strengthened while its stocks fell in early trading Wednesday after President Yoon Suk Yeol briefly declared martial law amid a political tussle, before moving to rescind the decree just hours later.
title: Korean Won Gains, Stocks Dip After President’s Brief Martial Law

description: Britain’s prison building program aimed at easing an overcrowding crisis will be five years late and cost almost double the original estimates, according to the spending watchdog.
title: Costs Almost Double in UK Building Program to Ease Prison Crisis
